famous_arts.name: Mona Lisa
famous_arts.description: The Mona Lisa is a half-length portrait painting by Italian artist Leonardo da Vinci. It is considered an archetypal masterpiece of the Italian Renaissance, and has been described as the best known, the most visited, the most written about, the most sung about, the most parodied work of art in the world.
famous_arts.significance: Revolutionary painting technique called sfumato, enigmatic smile, most famous painting in the world

famous_arts.name: The Starry Night
famous_arts.description: The Starry Night is an oil-on-canvas painting by Dutch Post-Impressionist painter Vincent van Gogh. Painted in June 1889, it depicts the view from the east-facing window of his asylum room at Saint-Rémy-de-Provence, just before sunrise, with the addition of an imaginary village.
famous_arts.location: Museum of Modern Art, New York
famous_arts.significance: Post-Impressionist masterpiece, swirling sky technique, emotional expression through color

famous_arts.name: Guernica
famous_arts.description: Guernica is a large 1937 oil painting on canvas by Spanish artist Pablo Picasso. It is one of his best-known works, regarded by many art critics as the most moving and powerful anti-war painting in history.
famous_arts.significance: Anti-war statement, Cubist masterpiece, political art

famous_arts.name: The Scream
famous_arts.description: The Scream is the popular name given to each of four versions of a composition, created as both paintings and pastels, by the Norwegian artist Edvard Munch. The agonized face in the painting has become one of the most iconic images of art.
famous_arts.medium: Oil, tempera, and pastel on cardboard
famous_arts.significance: Expressionist icon, anxiety and existential angst, modern art symbol

famous_arts.name: Girl with a Pearl Earring
famous_arts.description: Girl with a Pearl Earring is an oil painting by Dutch Golden Age painter Johannes Vermeer, dated c. 1665. Going by various names over the centuries, it became known by its current title towards the end of the 20th century.
famous_arts.significance: Dutch Golden Age masterpiece, mysterious subject, luminous pearl technique

famous_arts.name: The Great Wave off Kanagawa
famous_arts.description: The Great Wave off Kanagawa is a woodblock print by Japanese ukiyo-e artist Hokusai, created in late 1831 during the Edo period of Japanese history. The print depicts three boats moving through a storm-tossed sea, with a large wave forming a spiral in the center and Mount Fuji visible in the background.
famous_arts.significance: Japanese ukiyo-e masterpiece, symbol of Japan, influence on Western art
